column1: Art Institute of Chicago////What can I say that hasn't been said already?  The building is beautiful - the grounds and setting are stunning - the staff and docents are friendly - and the artwork is world renowned.  Of course
column3: like Seurat's "Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte" and Chagall's "America Window"
column4: that stunning stained glass piece.  But
column5: the museum offered some fun guides that spiced up our experience.  We followed the "Rock 'n Roll Lifestyle" tour as we meandered through the museum - seeking out the highlighted artworks for their no-holds-barred lust for life.  A great way to interest a museum companion that may not have your attention span for hours spent soaking in the art.  It also kept us going a little longer
column6: as we followed our hunt to the last painting.  If I lived in Chicago
column7: I'd be a member and know every piece in their collection.
